DataElement.preferredName: Person Cirrhosis Liver Function Test Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has cirrhoisis, a type of chronic, progressive liver disease in which liver cells are replaced by scar tissue, or other impaired liver function as determined by a quantitative measurement of liver enzymes, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cirrhosis Liver Function Test Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having cirrhoisis, a type of chronic, progressive liver disease in which liver cells are replaced by scar tissue, or other impaired liver function as determined by a quantitative measurement of liver enzymes, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Cirrhosis Liver Function Test Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A type of chronic, progressive liver disease in which liver cells are replaced by scar tissue.:The quantitative measurement of liver enzymes in the blood, which is useful in assessing the functional state of a patient's liver.  Liver function tests include the measurement of albumin, alanine transaminase, aspartate transaminase, alkaline phosphatase, bilirubin, and gamma glutamyl transferase.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by replacement of the liver parenchyma with fibrous tissue and regenerative nodules. It is usually caused by alcoholism, hepatitis B, and hepatitis C. Complications include the development of ascites, esophageal varices, bleeding, and hepatic encephalopathy.

The quantitative measurement of liver enzymes in the blood, which is useful in assessing the functional state of a patient's liver. Liver function tests include the measurement of albumin, alanine transaminase, aspartate transaminase, alkaline phosphatase, bilirubin, and gamma glutamyl transferase.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have liver c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have liver cirrhosis or any other impaired hepatic function as determined by serum enzymes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: No documented cirrhosis or documented acute hepatitis (NOTE: A positive hepatitis B serology indicative of previous immunization (i.e., HBsAb positive and HBcAb negative), or a fully resolved acute HBV infection is not an exclusion criterion.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cirrhosis, chronic hepatitis C virus positivity, or chronic hepatitis B infection (NOTE: A positive hepatitis B serology indicative of previous immunization (i.e., HBsAb-positive and HBcAb-negative), or a fully resolved acute hepatitis B infection is not an exclusion criterion.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Autoimmune hepatitis, cirrhosis or decompensated liver disease (Child-Pugh score > 6 [Class B and C])

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cirrhosis or chronic hepatitis C virus positivity or chronic hepatitis B infection (NOTE: A positive hepatitis B serology indicative of previous immunization (i.e., HBsAb-positive and HBcAb-negative), or a fully resolved acute HBV infection is not an exclusion criterion.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documented cirrhosis or documented acute hepatitis (NOTE: A positive hepatitis B serology indicative of previous immunization (i.e., HBsAb positive and HBcAb negative), or a fully resolved acute HBV infection is not an exclusion criterion.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have hepatic cirrhosis or severe pre-existing hepatic impairment

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known inherited or autoimmune liver disease impacting conjugated bilirubin (e.g., Alagille Syndrome, primary sclerosing cholangitis, other)?
